title.narrative: India: Enhancing Teacher Effectiveness in Bihar

description.narrative: The development objective of the Operation is to improve the effectiveness of elementary school teachers in Bihar.

participating-org.narrative: Bihar State Educational Infrastructure Development Corporation (BSEIDC)

baseline.value: (i)Teacher attendance at primary 81% (ii)Teacher attendance at upper primary 78% (does not include excused absence)

target.value: (i) Teachers attendance in primary school in year 5 has improved by 3 % in year 5 compared with baseline; and (ii) Teachersattendance in upper primary school has improved by 3% in year 5 compared with baseline

title.narrative: Indicator 2.1: Teacher management and attendance effectively monitored and evaluated

target.value: GOB has developed relevant ICT tools, and trained SMC members for effective teacher management , and monitoring.

actual.value: School support visits conducted by BEOs and BRCCs in at least 50% elementary schools across all 38 districts

title.narrative: Indicator 3.1:i.) % of procurement complaints handled satisfactorily in a timely manner. ii.)Strengthened internal audit framework established

target.value: i.90.00%ii. Audit Committee meets at-least 4 times in a financial year (target for year 4 2018-19)

title.narrative: Indicator 1.1: Number of institutions with improved physical and ICT infrastructure
Indicator 2.2: Improvement in Teacher Education Institutional Development Index scores

target.value: TEIDI end-line survey of TE Institutions surveyed in Year 1, evidences improvements in respective aggregate index score in at least10% of them.

title.narrative: 4. Percentage of teacher positions in TE institutions filled
5. Additional qualified elementary teachers resulting from program interventions
1. Beneficiaries (elementary school teachers covered through the program including % of female teachers)
2. Improved teacher performance effectively monitored through index based on scores

baseline.value: Baseline: Average language score 45%, average math score 58%

target.value: The average teacher performance score has improved by 10% from baseline survey of Year 1, as evidence by end-line survey in Year 5
State of Education Bihar Report on grades 3, 5 and 8 NAS survey including trend data/State level assessments
